value.label: API
value.description: Sends a simple GET request to an API endpoint defined in the Endpoints enum. Use this to ping an endpoint without any additional parameters.

value.label: API
value.description: Sends a GET request to an API endpoint with an added query parameter. For example, specify the page number to retrieve a particular page of results.

value.label: API
value.description: Sends a GET request to an API endpoint with an added path parameter. Use this to retrieve a specific resource, such as a user by ID.

value.label: API
value.description: Sends a DELETE request to an API endpoint by specifying a path parameter. Use this to delete a resource, for example, deleting a user by ID.

value.label: API
value.description: Sends a GET request to an endpoint with a custom header. Use this when the request requires specific headers such as authorization tokens or custom metadata.

value.label: API
value.description: Sends a POST request with a payload to an API endpoint. Use this to create a new resource by providing the required request body.

value.label: API
value.description: Sends a POST request with a payload to an API endpoint to perform login. The request body should include the login credentials.

value.label: API
value.description: Performs a soft validation using SoftAssertions. The validation logic is executed without immediately failing the test, allowing multiple assertions to be collected and verified at the end of the test execution.

value.label: API
value.description: Performs a hard validation that immediately fails the test if any assertion does not pass. Use this when critical conditions must be met and the test should halt on failure.

value.label: API
value.description: Sends a request to an API endpoint and validates the response using a comprehensive set of assertions. The following examples validate various aspects of the response:

value.label: API
value.description: Sends a GET request to the GET_USER endpoint with a path parameter and a custom header, then validates the status of the response. Use this pattern when the endpoint requires additional headers like authorization tokens.
value.example:
requestAndValidate(
  GET_USER.withPathParam(ID_PARAM, ID_THREE)
           .withHeader(SPECIFIC_HEADER, retrieve(StorageKeysApi.API, POST_LOGIN_USER, Response.class)
             .getBody().jsonPath().getString(TOKEN.getJsonPath())),
  Assertion.builder()
    .target(STATUS)
    .type(IS)
    .expected(SC_OK)
    .build()
)

value.label: API
value.description: Sends a POST request with a payload to an API endpoint and validates the response. For example, create a new user and then validate that the response status is 201 Created and that the returned user attributes match the expected values.
value.example:
requestAndValidate(POST_CREATE_USER, userLeader,
  Assertion.builder().target(STATUS).type(IS).expected(SC_CREATED).build(),
  Assertion.builder().target(BODY).key(CREATE_USER_NAME_RESPONSE.getJsonPath()).type(IS).expected(USER_LEADER_NAME).soft(true).build(),
  Assertion.builder().target(BODY).key(CREATE_USER_JOB_RESPONSE.getJsonPath()).type(IS).expected(USER_LEADER_JOB).soft(true).build()
)

requestAndValidate(POST_CREATE_USER, userSenior.join(),
  Assertion.builder().target(STATUS).type(IS).expected(SC_CREATED).build(),
  Assertion.builder().target(BODY).key(CREATE_USER_NAME_RESPONSE.getJsonPath()).type(IS).expected(USER_SENIOR_NAME).soft(true).build(),
  Assertion.builder().target(BODY).key(CREATE_USER_JOB_RESPONSE.getJsonPath()).type(IS).expected(USER_SENIOR_JOB).soft(true).build()
)

requestAndValidate(POST_CREATE_USER, user.join(),
  Assertion.builder().target(STATUS).type(IS).expected(SC_CREATED).build()
)

value.label: API
value.description: Validates a previously obtained API response with custom assertions. Useful if you've already retrieved a response (e.g., via 'retrieve(..., Response.class)' or a separate request call) and want to apply validations manually instead of using 'requestAndValidate(...)'.

value.label: API
value.description: Validates a 'not found' scenario by retrieving a response from storage and checking that the status code is 404. Ideal for scenarios where you manually store an invalid or missing user response and want to verify the error condition.

value.label: API
value.description: Ends the current fluent service (world) context and returns control to the main Quest. Use this when you're done performing operations in one world (e.g., API, UI, or DB) and want to transition to another or execute additional test steps.

value.label: API
value.description: Finalizes the execution flow in the current fluent service chain. This method should always be called at the end of the chainâ€”whether after requests, validations, or any other operations. Internally invokes the Quest's complete method, which clears test data and asserts any collected soft validations. Ensures the test concludes properly.

value.label: API
value.description: Demonstrates a custom retry scenario where the test polls a shared flag or any custom logic until true. Ideal for waiting on asynchronous operations, external triggers, or test data setup before continuing.
value.example:
retryUntil(
  sharedFlagIsTrue(),
  Duration.ofSeconds(10),
  Duration.ofSeconds(1)
)
.requestAndValidate(
  GET_ALL_USERS.withQueryParam(PAGE_PARAM, PAGE_TWO),
  Assertion.builder().target(STATUS).type(IS).expected(SC_OK).build()
)

value.label: API
value.description: Executes a hard validation by running logic inside a Runnable. If any assertion fails, the test stops immediately. Ideal for JUnit-style validations after requesting or retrieving API data.

value.label: API
value.description: Verifies the attributes of a resource (e.g., a newly created user) using hard JUnit assertions. If an assertion fails, the test halts immediately.

value.label: API
value.description: Executes a soft validation using SoftAssertions, allowing multiple checks to be gathered without ending the test upon a single failure. All collected assertions are ultimately validated at the end of the test flow (when 'complete()' is called).

value.label: API
value.description: Switches into the OLYMPYS world, which provides fluent API capabilities through RestServiceFluent. Use this for sending requests, validating responses, and chaining additional API actions.

value.label: API
value.description: Switches into the RIVENDELL world, where CustomService logic is available (e.g., user authentication flows, specialized request methods). Often followed by '.then()' to return to the main Quest or move to another world.

value.label: API
value.description: Switches into the GONDOR world, exposing the EvolutionService. Used for advanced test steps like 'createLeaderUserAndValidateResponse'.

value.label: API
value.description: Retrieves a stored API response using the GET_ALL_USERS endpoint key and deserializes it to GetUsersResponse for validation.

value.label: API
value.description: Retrieves the raw response object from storage using the POST_CREATE_USER key. Useful for status code validation or token extraction.

value.label: API
value.description: Retrieves the stored response from the API sub-storage using the GET_ALL_USERS key and deserializes it to a typed response DTO for assertion.

value.label: API
value.description: Retrieves the stored user creation response from API sub-storage using the POST_CREATE_USER key. Use this to validate returned user data fields after creation.

value.label: API
value.description: Retrieves a specific value from an already stored API response using a custom DataExtractor. Use this approach when you have a JSONPath or logic-based extractor that pulls specific fields out of the stored API data.

value.label: API
value.description: Demonstrates retrieving a typed object with domain fields from a JSON response using a custom extraction logic. Perfect for cases where you parse a response into a targeted DTO.

value.label: API
value.description: Retrieves a specific element from stored API data using a DataExtractor and an index. Use this when your stored data represents a list (e.g., array of users), and you want to extract a particular item at the given position.

value.label: API
value.description: Allows accessing indexed elements in response arrays when validating paginated or batch-based API calls. Index helps isolate the exact record for assertions.

value.label: API
value.description: Target used to validate the HTTP status code of an API response. Does not require a 'key' field. Typically compared against constants like SC_OK or integer values (e.g., 200).

value.label: API
value.description: Target used to validate the body of the API response. Requires the 'key' field to specify a JSON path (e.g., 'data.email', 'support.url'). Works with value-based assertion types like IS, CONTAINS, MATCHES_REGEX, etc.

value.label: API
value.description: Target used to validate a specific HTTP response header. Requires the 'key' field to define the header name (e.g., 'Content-Type', 'Authorization'). Compared against expected string values or patterns.

value.label: API
value.description: Asserts that the actual value is equal to the expected one. Works with any object, string, or number.

value.label: API
value.description: Asserts that the actual value is not equal to the expected one. Works with any object, string, or number.

value.label: API
value.description: Asserts that the actual string contains the expected substring.

value.label: API
value.description: Asserts that the actual value is not null.

value.label: API
value.description: Asserts that all values in a list or collection are not null.

value.label: API
value.description: Asserts that the value is null.

value.label: API
value.description: Asserts that a numeric value is greater than the expected number.

value.label: API
value.description: Asserts that a numeric value is less than the expected number.

value.label: API
value.description: Asserts that all expected elements exist in the actual collection.

value.label: API
value.description: Asserts that at least one of the expected elements exists in the actual collection.

value.label: API
value.description: Asserts that a string starts with the specified prefix.

value.label: API
value.description: Asserts that a string ends with the specified suffix.

value.label: API
value.description: Asserts that the value has the expected length. Works for strings, lists, etc.

value.label: API
value.description: Asserts that a string matches the given regular expression.

value.label: API
value.description: Asserts that the collection is empty.

value.label: API
value.description: Asserts that the collection is not empty.

value.label: API
value.description: Asserts that a number falls within a specified inclusive range. Expected must be a List of exactly 2 elements: [min, max].

value.label: API
value.description: Asserts that two strings are equal, ignoring case sensitivity.

value.label: API
value.description: Marks a test class as an API test. Enables request execution, response validation, and API authentication handling through the ApiTestExtension.

value.label: API
value.description: Specifies that the test method should perform authentication via API before executing the main test logic. The credentials and authentication client type are defined through this annotation.

value.label: API
value.description: Defines a sequence of API test setup steps ('journeys') that should run before the test execution. Each journey represents an action like user creation, configured in a specific order.

value.label: API
value.description: Defines a precondition setup step within the @PreQuest annotation. Specifies the setup journey to be executed before the test, along with optional journey data and execution order.

value.label: API
value.description: Defines specific test data to be injected for the associated journey. It typically references an enum constant used to generate API request payloads.

value.label: API
value.description: Specifies post-test cleanup logic for the test method. Commonly used to delete test data created in preconditions or during execution. The specified targets map to cleanup routines like removing users or resetting state.

value.label: API
value.description: Injects a test user object into the test method using a predefined model (e.g., USER_JUNIOR). The injected object is resolved lazily and used as the request body.

value.label: API
value.description: Injects two predefined user models into the test method: one resolved immediately and one resolved lazily. Each is used to create a user and validate the response.

value.label: API
value.description: Marks a test method as part of the regression suite. This example shows regression tagging for a test that creates and validates a user in the Reqres API.

value.label: API
value.description: Annotates a key API test or an entire test class to perform a high-level, critical endpoint check. The test must pass quickly to confirm basic API readiness.
